metadata: (info { (description "Chungani was a game played by the Inka. Little is known about it, as it was mentioned by Spanish chroniclers but who did not completely describe it.") (aliases {"Chuncani" "Chuncana" "Chuncaycuna" "Ccullu Chuncana" "Chuncara"}) (rules "Five holes dug on a table. Played with beans. Played with dice. Players moved the beans from one space to another according to the dice. The first space is worth ten, the second twenty, the third thirty, up to fifty.") (source "DLP Evidence.") (id "333") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/race/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in South America, from around 1595 to 1653.") } ) (graphics { (show Edges Hidden) (show Symbol "disc" Vertex (sites Board) fillColour:(colour 223 178 110) edgeColour:(colour Black) scale:0.9) }) (recon { (concept "Dice" True) })
